Note: Minor spoilers ahead

So I decided to sit down and attempt to play all of HL2: Episode One. I had played it before on Xbox with the Orange Box, but now I wanted to actually finally finish it on the PC (I only got to Lowlife and never finished). And you know what?

It was a solid HL2 game, to be honest. It did a good job at expanding the original storyline of HL2, adding stuff where you and Alyx basically escape the Citadel and make it out of City 17. Along the way, you encounter Combine Soldiers (who breach doors at least 3 times in the game), attacking Gunships, Antlions, Headcrabs, Zombies, and a new type of zombie - the Zombine (they’re Combine Zombies, heh). 

You also enter a lot of new areas, from the Citadel core to various railways and parking garages. Eventually, you make it up to the surface and move through parking areas and Combine defenses, even a few apartments. You also go to a hospital, where you and Alyx fight through Combine troops and Zombies before shooting down a Gunship.

The game’s about 3 hours (at least that’s how long it took me to finish), although some say it’s between 4 and 6. Overall, I recommend it if you want to see more of the HL2 “trilogy”.
This game takes what the previous two games in Half Life and just outdoes them!!

A true classic. This is the fourth time I have bought this game and played it through and through. Yes its just a basic linear fps game for most people nowadays, but it really was ahead of its time back then. Back when Valve made games. Although tbh valve bought studios that made games.

If you have never played this, seriously, what are u waiting for. It very cheap nowadays so I don't think its too much to ask for to experience a true great classic.

Plus it is moddable to a point, so it depends on how much work you are willing to do for modding. From simple to overhauls, its all in your choice.

9/10. Wake up, smell the ashes...

Grając w kontynuacje Half-Life 2 czułem się dość dziwnie, ta sama opowieść która opowiada o przygodach Gordona Freemana, a czułem się jakbym grał w Fanmade, może to dlatego że gra była dość krótka, przejście całej gry z wszystkimi osiągnięciami zajęło mi około 5 godzin.

Si bien sigue siendo el mismo Half life 2, si se nota una muy gran diferencia entre la entrega original y esta secuela, ya que su duración comparada con la precuela es muchísima más menor, lo cual te hace desear más, aunque la jugabilidad de esta parte cojea bastante, ya que llegas a un punto en el que simplemente deseas que se termine el juego, por lo frustrante e innecesariamente complicado de algunos escenarios...

Half-Life 3 when?

[h1]Беги, Аликс, беги![/h1]

Продолжение сюжета Half-Life 2 не заставило себя долго ждать. Valve, будучи любителями причислять себя к невероятным инноваторам, решили "придумать" подачу игр эпизодами на 2-3 часа. Стоимость эпизодов, естественно, не сильно отличалась на выходе от стоимости полноценной игры.

Опустим маркетинг и поговорим об игре. Никаких нововведений, в сравнении с HL2, почти нет. Только зомбайн и Аликс в качестве напарника. Сюжет предлагает нам подробнее взглянуть на Цитадель изнутри, посопереживать эвакуирующимся жителям Сити-17 и попугаться зомби в темноте.

На самом деле, если бы эта игра не была частью Half-Life 2, о ней бы сейчас никто бы и не помнил. Это не значит, что она плохая, её точно стоит пройти. Но факт остается фактом: это лишь несколько уровней к Half-Life 2, двигающих её сюжет и выделенные в отдельную "игру".
short but cool

Doesn't work as a stand alone experience at all. Minus the voice acting this is on the same level as a mediocre Source mod.

Not only that but it's ridiculously short at mere 3h play time. And you could easily 100% all the achievements too in that time.

Short but good, if you liked Half-Life 2 you will like this game. This game is just more Half-Life 2, it isn't a big improvement like from Half-Life 1 to 2, but is still fun. In this one you have to interact with npcs a lot more and there are new combine zombies. Other than that there are no big changes and nothing revolutionary, but this game is still fun. Overall I recommend it! [b]9/10[/b]
